title: Sheet Pan Shrimp and Sausage Bake Recipe
description: A wonderful sheet pan dinner with shrimp, sausage, corn, and lots of vegetables. You can prepare all the vegetables while the potatoes and corn pre-boil.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Seafood Shellfish Shrimp Sheet Pan Shrimp and Sausage Bake 4.8 (213) 173 Reviews 111 Photos Easy shrimp and sausage bake, delicious, healthier, and gluten free, all on one big sheet pan in the oven! Submitted by ashley Updated on November 16, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 111 111 111 111 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings cooking spray 1 pound baby Yukon Gold potatoes, quartered 4 ears corn, husked 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided 3 tablespoons Creole seasoning 1 lemon, juiced 1 tablespoon minced garlic 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning 1 teaspoon paprika, divided ¬Ω teaspoon red pepper flakes 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper 1 red bell pepper, cut into 2-inch pieces 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into 2-inch pieces 1 orange bell pepper, cut into 2-inch pieces 1 ¬Ω cups cherry tomatoes, halved 1 onion, cut into 2-inch pieces 4 andouille sausages, sliced 1 lemon, cut into wedges 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined ¬Ω teaspoon Creole seasoning 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, or to taste finely chopped green onion, or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients.Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray a large sheet pan with cooking spray. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add corn and boil for an additional 5 minutes. Drain. Cut corn into thirds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, combine 3 tablespoons olive oil, 3 tablespoons Creole seasoning, juice from 1 lemon, garlic, Italian seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Mix well to combine and set seasoning mixture aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine boiled potatoes and corn, all the bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, onion, and sausage slices in a large bowl. Add seasoning mixture and mix evenly. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spread potato mixture onto a sheet pan in a single layer. Place lemon wedges evenly on all sides of the sheet pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes. Meanwhile, combine shrimp, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, and 1/2 teaspoon Creole seasoning in a bowl. Marinate for a few minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add shrimp to the sheet pan with the potato mixture after 8 minutes of baking and mix to combine. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Return sheet pan to the oven and cook until shrimp are opaque, 6 to 8 minutes. Remove lemon wedges and garnish with parsley and green onions. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 520 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Shrimp and Sausage Bake 01 of 111 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 111 Photo by¬† Gwen Raymond 02/22/2025 It was tedious to make with all the different ingredients that needed to be added, and when I started, I said I will not make this again. But, I might because the results were great. It was real good. The only thing I did not do was green onions‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. So I might do it again, lol but not too soon. 03 of 111 Photo by¬† Memaw 08/09/2024 Great flavors A keeper! Worth the effort This is fantastic! 04 of 111 Photo by¬† Donna Gluecklich-Sullivan 08/20/2023 This was really delicious! It made a LOT of food! Next time I will only make 1/2 the recipe, but other than that, not change a thing!! Thank you for this recipe, my family loved it!!! 05 of 111 Photo by¬† bobm 11/24/2022 Next time I make it, I will be a bit less vigorous in adding the Cajan and red peppers. It was almost too spicy (Hot), but we loved it anyways 06 of 111 Photo by¬† Sheila James Porter 11/04/2022 Was very delicious!Aldo added crab 07 of 111 Photo by¬† PlushPan5379 08/31/2022 Excellent. Made my own Creole seasoning by using basil, oregano, thyme and cyanne. Then added all to the paprika, pepper flakes, salt, garlic, olive oil and lemon juice. Used 3/4 of that mix for the vegetables and sausage and saved the rest to marinate the shrimp. Will make it again. It is super with fresh sweet corn 08 of 111 Photo by¬† CoolSieve7941 07/04/2022 Delicious! No need to go out for this meal it‚Äôs better made at home, family loves it too. 09 of 111 Photo by¬† Lynn McA 06/19/2022 Restaurant quality, delicious. Didn‚Äôt have any creole spice so I used Epicure Jamaican spice. Hubby & son loved it! ü§§ü§§ 10 of 111 Photo by¬† workinlady68 01/30/2022 Awesome recipe. Family loved it!!! I only had russet potatoes, smoked sausage and I used Cajun seasoning instead of Creole but it all worked out. I will definitely be making this fulfilling meal again. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love 20-Minute Shrimp Fajitas Sheet Pan Dinner 6 Ratings Easy Sheet Pan Shrimp Fajitas 12 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Jerk Shrimp 35 Ratings Easy Creole Okra and Shrimp 88 Ratings Shrimp and Vegetable Sheet Pan Dinner 14 Ratings Grilled BBQ Shrimp with Citrus Corn Salad 17 Ratings Shrimp Cakes with Old Bay¬Æ 1 Rating Shish Kabob a la Holly 6 Ratings Honey-Garlic Shrimp and Pineapple Skewers 3 Ratings Spanish Rice and Shrimp 3 Ratings Creamy Shrimp √âtouff√©e 5 Ratings Prawns and Vegetables Over Pan-Fried Udon Noodles 3 Ratings Easy Crab Cakes 1 Rating Shrimp Scampi with Tomatoes, Pasta, and Roasted Asparagus 2 Ratings Crawfish Macquechou 6 Ratings Seafood Cioppino 222 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
